tasks.title: Push 'ai interview assistant' to top 3
tasks.description: Currently position 5.8 with 5.4K impressions. Need dedicated landing page and content strategy.

tasks.title: Consolidate blog subdomain 301 redirects
tasks.description: blog.interviewsidekick.com is still getting traffic and splitting domain authority. Needs 301 redirects to main domain. Easy SEO win.

tasks.title: Enable GSC for CLCP and SE keyword tracking
tasks.description: Currently only tracking ISK keywords. CLCP organic traffic is declining with zero attention. Need to expand GSC coverage to all 3 products.

tasks.title: Wire Mission Control to live data
tasks.description: Activity feed, calendar, memory pages need to pull from real data sources instead of the nightly JSON push. Future state: live API calls vs nightly mc-data.json sync.

tasks.title: Build content strategy for ISK landing pages
tasks.description: Create dedicated landing pages targeting high-impression keywords like 'ai interview assistant'. ISK is a live interview tool, not prep — content must reflect that.

tasks.title: Give Cara her first real task
tasks.description: Cara has never been used. Define her first scope: churn analysis, billing support, or customer health report. She owns customer/billing data.

tasks.title: Enable Search Console API in Google Cloud Console
tasks.description: Ben needs to manually enable the GSC API in Cloud Console so Miles can pull keyword/ranking data programmatically. Blocked on Ben.

tasks.title: Set up competitor keyword tracking
tasks.description: Track competitor keyword positions for all products. Alternative pages are ISK's #1 non-brand traffic driver — need to know what competitors are doing.

tasks.title: Investigate ISK traffic drop (-30%)
tasks.description: ISK traffic dropped 30% vs last Wednesday per Dana's morning report. Needs root cause analysis — algorithm change, seasonal, or something else.

tasks.title: Set up weekly UGC performance tracking (Mia)
tasks.description: Mia audited the sheet once on Feb 18. Needs recurring weekly pull — is Nick's 2.8M still growing or plateauing? Track milestones.

tasks.title: Set up Convex for MC database
tasks.description: Mission Control needs a proper database backend instead of static JSON push. Convex was the agreed direction.

tasks.title: Create persistent weekly metrics file (Dana)
tasks.description: Dana's morning reports vanish into Telegram. Need memory/weekly-metrics-YYYY-MM-DD.md every Monday covering all 3 products — traffic, revenue, MoM trends. Without this, spotting problems before they become crises is impossible.

tasks.title: Run Cara's first churn/billing health report
tasks.description: Churn rate, refund rate, cancellations within 7 days — none of this has been looked at. Data exists in Stripe. Cara should own memory/billing-health-YYYY-MM.md monthly.

tasks.title: Create HEARTBEAT.md
tasks.description: Referenced in AGENTS.md and SOP but never created. Needed for heartbeat poll context and periodic check coordination.

tasks.title: CLCP organic SEO — stop the decline
tasks.description: CLCP organic traffic is declining and Miles has spent zero time on it (ISK-only focus). Need GSC access + keyword audit + at least one actionable recommendation. This is real revenue being left on the table.

calendar.title: Penny Daily Check
calendar.description: Penny's overnight quality sweep — delegation audit, cron/MC drift check, file hygiene scan. Observe-only.

calendar.title: Daily GSC Report — All Products (Miles)
calendar.description: Miles pulls GSC data for ISK, CLCP, SE — tracked keywords, clicks, impressions, position trends. Daily 6 AM CAT.

calendar.description: Sam's morning coffee read — overnight results, costs, priorities. 7:30 AM CAT.

calendar.title: Morning Analytics Report
calendar.description: Dana pulls Datafast metrics for all 3 products — visitors, revenue, week-over-week trends. 8 AM CAT.

calendar.title: Mia: Weekly UGC Performance Report
calendar.description: Mia analyzes creator performance — views, posts, CPM, trends. Tuesdays 8 AM CAT.

decisions.title: Agent Knowledge Briefs
decisions.description: Create persistent agent briefs in /workspace/agents/ so sub-agents load context from files instead of re-explaining everything. Reduces context waste, improves delegation efficiency.

decisions.title: Dev Agent Created (Devin 🛠️)
decisions.description: Add a Web Developer agent to own the MC codebase. Sam was writing code directly, violating the orchestrator role.

decisions.title: Weekly GSC Report Format
decisions.description: Use date ranges as column headers (e.g. '2/10-2/16'), current partial week + last full week + T-30 avg. Ben prefers concrete dates over ambiguous labels like 'this week'.

decisions.title: Delegation Audit Cron
decisions.description: Daily cron at 6 PM CAT to review Sam's delegation compliance. Need oversight to ensure Sam orchestrates rather than executes.

decisions.title: ISK Keyword Focus: During-Interview Only
decisions.description: Track 'during interview' keywords (ai interview assistant, helper, etc.) not prep keywords. ISK is a live interview tool, not a practice/prep tool.

decisions.title: Sonnet for sub-agents
decisions.description: Use Claude Sonnet (claude-sonnet-4-6) for sub-agents and background tasks. Opus (claude-opus-4-6) remains the default for main sessions. Balances cost and speed for autonomous background work.

decisions.title: Auto-fallback model config
decisions.description: When context gets long or for delegated tasks, automatically fall back from Opus to Sonnet. Configured in openclaw model settings. Prevents context blowout on expensive tasks.

decisions.title: Sync after work chunks, not on fixed schedule
decisions.description: The nightly MC sync (Sam, 2 AM CAT) updates data after work happens rather than on a rigid push schedule. mc-data.json is the canonical source; synced after meaningful work sessions, not every hour.

decisions.title: Dev Agent Created
decisions.description: - **Decision:** Add a Web Developer agent (Dev 🛠️) to own the MC codebase

decisions.title: Delegation Audit
decisions.description: - **Decision:** Daily cron at 6 PM CAT to review Sam's delegation compliance

decisions.title: ISK Keyword Focus
decisions.description: - **Decision:** Track "during interview" keywords (ai interview assistant, helper, etc.) not prep keywords

decisions.title: Sync After Work Chunks (Not Fixed Schedule)
decisions.description: - **Decision:** mc-data.json syncs after meaningful work sessions, not on a rigid hourly push. Nightly MC sync at 2 AM CAT is the floor, not the ceiling.

bashCrons.title: MC Data Sync
bashCrons.description: The system heartbeat — reads all OpenClaw session files every 10 min, extracts agent activity, costs, and run history, then pushes to Supabase (instant) and GitHub (triggers Vercel deploy). Skips entirely if no sessions changed since last run.

bashCrons.title: Mercury Creator Sync
bashCrons.description: Frankie pulls all outgoing transactions from Mercury banking (3 accounts) and maps payments to the 7 UGC creators by name. Writes creator-payouts.json with total paid, payment count, and last payment date per creator.

bashCrons.title: Creator Posts Sync
bashCrons.description: Mia pulls the latest post data for all 7 creators from Google Sheets — TikTok and Instagram URLs, view counts, and post dates. Writes creator-posts.json with 267+ posts sorted newest-first per creator.

bashCrons.title: Creator Data Merge
bashCrons.description: Merges Frankie's Mercury payouts and Mia's post data into a single creator-data.json that both the /creators page and individual creator pages read from. Runs 30 min after each source sync (12:30 PM and 1:30 AM CAT) so the data is always fresh.

bashCrons.title: Health Snapshot
bashCrons.description: Collects server health metrics (disk, memory, uptime, OpenClaw, Tailscale, Vercel, crons, pending updates) and writes health.json to mission-control/public/. Runs daily at 6:30 AM CAT (4:30 UTC) before morning reports.
